intro: Linaria bordiana subsp. kralikiana, commonly known as the Kralik's toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, and the flowers bloom from late spring to early summer. This subspecies is adapted to harsh, alpine environments and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
